metadata.name: Narrative Structures Dataset
metadata.description: Story structures and patterns from Grimms' Fairy Tales

linear_quest.text: Protagonist sets out to find a specific magical object (Golden Bird, Water of Life)
Character must search for missing or kidnapped siblings or loved ones
Hero must discover the name or true identity of a magical being
Youngest sibling embarks on journey where older siblings have failed
Character must travel to a distant, dangerous location to obtain a cure or remedy

trial_task_structure.text: Protagonist must complete three impossible tasks to win a prize or break a spell
Character must watch over something for three consecutive nights
Hero must answer three riddles or questions to save their life
Tasks test virtue (kindness, obedience) rather than strength or skill
Each task is more difficult than the previous one

transformation_restoration.text: Character is transformed into an animal due to a curse or enchantment
Person is turned to stone and must be restored by specific action
Transformation occurs through breaking a taboo or disobeying instructions
Restoration requires an act of true love or faithfulness
Character moves between social states (poverty to royalty) through magical intervention

punishment_reward.text: Kindness to strangers or animals is rewarded with magical assistance
Pride, greed, or cruelty leads to fitting supernatural punishment
Breaking promises results in immediate negative consequences
Humility and honesty are rewarded with marriage to royalty
Punishment often mirrors the crime (greedy person drowns in gold)

cause_effect.text: Simple action triggers significant, immediate magical consequences
Uttering a rash wish causes supernatural events
Interacting with a magical object sets the plot in motion
Breaking a taboo unleashes supernatural forces
Small kindness to magical being leads to life-changing reward

cyclical_repetition.text: Character attends an event (ball, market) three times with escalating stakes
Villain makes multiple attempts to harm protagonist, each more dangerous
Helper fails multiple times before succeeding on final attempt
Pattern of three brothers or sisters attempting the same task
Repeated magical phrases or actions with slight variations each time

hidden_identity.text: Royal character disguised as commoner (goose-girl, gardener's boy)
Enchanted prince/princess in animal form seeking to break spell
True identity revealed at climactic moment through token or birthmark
Character in disguise tests loyalty of others
Magical being conceals true nature until specific conditions are met

simpleton_success.text: Character deemed foolish by family succeeds where clever siblings fail
Success comes through inherent goodness rather than intelligence
Simple character follows instructions literally when others overthink
Kindness to nature/magical beings brings unexpected aid to the simpleton
Apparent foolishness reveals itself as wisdom by story's end
